<rss version="2.0"><channel><link>http://techreport.com</link><title>The Tech Report - News</title><description>PC Hardware Explored</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:05:00 -0500</pubDate><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30121/nvidia-enjoys-healthy-growth-in-its-fiscal-first-quarter</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30121/nvidia-enjoys-healthy-growth-in-its-fiscal-first-quarter</guid><title>Nvidia enjoys healthy growth in its fiscal first quarter</title><description><p>Nvidia has released its <a href="http://nvidianews.nvidia.com/news/nvidia-announces-financial-results-for-first-quarter-fiscal-2017">financial results</a> for the first quarter of its fiscal 2017. The company posted&nbsp; quarterly revenue of $1.3 billion, a year-over-year gain of 13%, beating its projection of $1.26 billion for this quarter. Nvidia also made $245 million in operating income, a 39% improvement over the same quarter last year.&nbsp;</p><p>The company <a href="http://files.shareholder.com/downloads/AMDA-1XAJD4/2052997668x0x891766/878F4C1B-2D21-4C3C-8882-43D78A363F58/Q117_CFO_Commentary.pdf">made most of its revenue from GPU sales</a> , and most of that money came from the gaming market. GPU sales totaled $1.08 billion, up 15% year-over-year. The gaming segment accounted for $687 million of that revenue. Nvidia appears to have  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30121/nvidia-enjoys-healthy-growth-in-its-fiscal-first-quarter">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:05:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/review/30095/hyperx-cloud-revolver-gaming-headset-reviewed</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/review/30095/hyperx-cloud-revolver-gaming-headset-reviewed</guid><title>HyperX's Cloud Revolver gaming headset reviewed</title><description><p><span class="smallcaps" style="text-align:center;">For many gamers</span>, a good headset is sturdy, comfortable, and not too flashy, and the popularity of <a href="http://www.hyperxgaming.com/us/cloud/">HyperX's Cloud and Cloud II headsets</a> attests to how well the company has hit that mark.Â I've spent a bit of time with the Cloud II in the past, and I can attest to its quality. Given that experience, I'm excited to have a look at HyperX's latest gaming headset: <a href="http://www.hyperxgaming.com/us/cloud/hx-hscr">the Cloud Revolver</a>.</p><p><img height="388" src="http://techreport.com/r.x/2016_5_8_HyperXs_Cloud_Revolver_reviewed/sideview2.png" width="620">  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/review/30095/hyperx-cloud-revolver-gaming-headset-reviewed">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:58:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30119/thursday-shortbread</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30119/thursday-shortbread</guid><title>Thursday Shortbread</title><description><strong><u>Eight is Enough</u></strong>
<p>
<ol type = "I">
<li>AnandTech: HDD shipments down <a href="http://www.anandtech.com/show/10315/market-views-hdd-shipments-down-q1-2016">20%</a> in Q1 2016, hit multi-year low
<li>PCGamesN: Nvidia <a href="http://www.pcgamesn.com/nvidia-only-supporting-2-way-sli-with-gtx-1000-series">only natively</a> supporting 2-way SLI with GTX 1000 series
<li>VideoCardz: Zotac <a href="http://videocardz.com/59857/zotac-teases-geforce-gtx-1080-pgf-edition-and-new-firestorm">teases</a> GeForce GTX<br>
1080 PGF Edition and new Firestorm utility
<li>VR-Zone: First AMD "<a href="http://vr-zone.com/articles/first-amd-polaris-radeon-graphics-cards-expected-month-end/109577.html">Polaris</a>" Radeon graphics cards expected by month-end
<li><a href="http://9to5mac.com/2016/05/11/kgi-apple-iphone-7-plus-5-5-inch-dual-camera-3gb-ram/">KGI</a>: Apple's full iPhone 7 Plus 5.5-inch lineup<br>
to adopt dual-camera, 3GB of RAM - 9to5Mac
<li>Ars Technica: Google's "<a href="http://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2016/05/googles-gboard-for-ios-combines-a-keyboard-with-google-search/">Gboard</a>" for iOS<br>
combines a keyboard with Google Search
<li>Linux <a href="https://lwn.net/Articles/687055/">4.5.4</a>
<li>LibreOffice <a href="https://blog.documentfoundation.org/blog/2016/05/12/libreoffice-5-1-3-available-for-download/">5.1.3</a>
</ol>
<p>
<p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30119/thursday-shortbread">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:32:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30118/zotac-adds-two-stick-pcs-to-its-zbox-lineup</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30118/zotac-adds-two-stick-pcs-to-its-zbox-lineup</guid><title>Zotac adds two stick PCs to its Zbox lineup</title><description><p>Zotac&rsquo;s Zbox is a pretty <a href="http://techreport.com/review/29208/zotac-zbox-magnus-en970-reviewed">well-respected</a> <a href="http://techreport.com/review/26941/zotac-zbox-id92-mini-pc-reviewed">name </a>around here. The Zbox family has a reputation for cramming powerful components into tiny enclosures without compromising too much on fan noise. Now Zotac has announced two new members of the Zbox family: the Zbox PI221 and Zbox PI220 stick PCs.</p><p>These machines have a&nbsp;shared set of specs. Both hang off of an HDMI port for video and for mounting, like the <a href="http://techreport.com/review/28147/intel-compute-stick-miniature-pc-reviewed">Intel Compute Stick</a> , and draw power from a single USB port. They both have a 10/100&nbsp;Ethernet port, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, and  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30118/zotac-adds-two-stick-pcs-to-its-zbox-lineup">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:53:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30117/dual-chambered-lian-li-pc-o9-is-a-big-beautiful-case</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30117/dual-chambered-lian-li-pc-o9-is-a-big-beautiful-case</guid><title>Dual-chambered Lian Li PC-O9 is a big, beautiful case</title><description><p>Taiwanese computer chassis manufacturer Lian Li might offer one of the widest variety of cases on the market. From <a href="http://techreport.com/news/27256/lian-li-latest-mini-itx-chassis-houses-11-hard-drives">ITX cases that hold eleven drives</a> to <a href="http://techreport.com/news/30014/lian-li-dk-04-case-doubles-as-a-powered-standing-desk">motorized standing desk computer cases</a>, Lian Li probably has you covered. Last year at Computex, the company <a href="http://techreport.com/news/28387/dont-throw-stones-inside-lian-li-pc-o8">showed off the PC-O8</a>, a <a href="http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811112471">large, dual-chamber design with tempered glass side panels</a>. This year, Lian Li is&nbsp;revising the design with a little less glass and a little more color to make <a href="http://www.lian-li.com/en/dt_portfolio/pc-o9/">the PC-O9</a>.</p><p><img height="714" src="http://techreport.com/r.x/2016_5_12_Dualchambered_LianLi_PC09_is_big_and_beautiful/PC09WRX_1.jpg" width="620" />  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30117/dual-chambered-lian-li-pc-o9-is-a-big-beautiful-case">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:03:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30116/radeon-software-crimson-edition-16-5-2-is-doom-ready</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30116/radeon-software-crimson-edition-16-5-2-is-doom-ready</guid><title>Radeon Software Crimson Edition 16.5.2 is Doom-ready</title><description><p>AMD is keeping up the pace of its driver releases with <a href="http://support.amd.com/en-us/kb-articles/Pages/AMD-Radeon-Software-Crimson-Edition-16.5.2.aspx">Radeon Software Crimson Edition 16.5.2</a>. The highlight of the release is support for <em><a href="http://techreport.com/news/28462/there-a-new-doom-on-the-horizon-and-there-will-be-blood">Doom</a></em> and a new <a href="http://techreport.com/news/28779/battleborn-gets-a-february-release-date-and-a-fresh-trailer"><em>Battleborn</em></a> AMD Crossfire profile. Additionally, AMD has addressed a variety of bugs in the Radeon Settings software and fixed graphical issues in <em>Hitman</em>, <em>League of Legends</em> and <em>Star Wars: Battlefront.</em></p><p>AMD fixed a number of other issues in this release, as well. The biggest change is that the Radeon Settings should no longer recommend a downgrade to an older driver revision when using the new driver notification feature. The &quot;restore factory defaults&quot;  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30116/radeon-software-crimson-edition-16-5-2-is-doom-ready">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 09:25:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30115/gear-vr-oculus-home-app-gets-some-extra-polish</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30115/gear-vr-oculus-home-app-gets-some-extra-polish</guid><title>Gear VR's Oculus Home app gets some extra polish</title><description><p>When we talk about VR here, we usually talk about the Oculus Rift and the HTC Vive. Samsung&#39;s Gear VR <a href="https://twitter.com/PalmerLuckey/status/730481661599617024">is a major platform in its own right, too</a>. The Gear VR is only $100, but it requires a recent Samsung smartphone to operate&nbsp;and lacks some of the niceties of the other&nbsp;HMDs. It does have&nbsp;one major advantage, though&mdash;<a href="http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16886995148">it&#39;s readily available</a>. Oculus is now looking to <a href="https://www.oculus.com/en-us/blog/gear-vr-ecosystem-expands-to-include-facebook-360-photos-over-250-apps-and-new-video-content/">widen the appeal</a> of the Gear VR by making it easier for customers to find and share VR content.</p><p><img height="351" src="http://techreport.com/r.x/2016_5_11_Gear_VR_set_to_receive_Oculus_Home_update_support_360_photos_on_Facebo/gearvrtrimmed.jpg" width="620" />  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30115/gear-vr-oculus-home-app-gets-some-extra-polish">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 07:49:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30114/asus-pce-a88-wi-fi-adapter-could-outpace-wired-networks</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30114/asus-pce-a88-wi-fi-adapter-could-outpace-wired-networks</guid><title>Asus PCE-A88 Wi-Fi adapter could outpace wired networks</title><description><p>Anandtech has gotten wind of some fancy new networking hardware from Asus: the <a href="http://www.anandtech.com/show/10306/asus-unveils-pce-ac88-4x4-wifi-card">PCE-AC88 4x4 Wi-Fi adapter</a>. According to the site, this PCIe x1 802.11ac card is capable of throughput of up to 2167Mb/s&mdash;theoretically higher than most wired Ethernet installations in the home.</p><p><img height="392" src="http://techreport.com/r.x/2016_5_11_Asus_releases_PCEAC88_PCIe_WiFi_addin_board/AsusWifi1.jpg" width="343" />  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30114/asus-pce-a88-wi-fi-adapter-could-outpace-wired-networks">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 15:41:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30113/rumor-amd-may-pull-vega-gpu-forward-for-an-october-launch</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30113/rumor-amd-may-pull-vega-gpu-forward-for-an-october-launch</guid><title>Rumor: AMD may pull Vega GPU forward for an October launch</title><description><p>AMD roadmaps from the&nbsp;<a href="http://techreport.com/blog/29851/radeon-pro-duo-spearheads-amd-push-for-vr-dominance">Capsaicin event in March</a> showed its mid-range&nbsp;Polaris GPUs launching in mid-2016, while the presumably higher-end Vega GPU was supposed to follow sometime in 2017. Rumors flying around the web now indicate&nbsp;that AMD has advanced&nbsp;Vega&#39;s launch to mid-October after Nvidia&#39;s <a href="http://techreport.com/news/30094/nvidia-makes-the-gtx-1070-and-gtx-1080-official">GTX 1080 announcement</a>.</p><p><img height="334" src="http://techreport.com/r.x/2016_3_14_Radeon_Pro_Duo_spearheads_AMDs_push_for_VR_dominance/roadmap.jpg" width="620" />  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30113/rumor-amd-may-pull-vega-gpu-forward-for-an-october-launch">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 14:50:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30112/clear-your-schedule-in-advance-of-civilization-vi-october-21-launch</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30112/clear-your-schedule-in-advance-of-civilization-vi-october-21-launch</guid><title>Clear your schedule in advance of Civilization VI's October 21 launch</title><description><p>Firaxis has announced <em>Civilization VI</em>. I&#39;m going to let that fact sink in, along with its implications for all your spare time. Polygon <a href="http://www.polygon.com/features/2016/5/11/11653620/civilization-6-release-date-preview">published an interview</a> with Firaxis&#39; lead designer Ed Beach, detailing all the wondrous new ways in which you&#39;ll forego the company of your family and friends for months on end.</p><p><img height="339" src="http://techreport.com/r.x/2016_5_11_Clear_your_schedule_for_Civilization_VI/civ6_1.jpg" width="620" />  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30112/clear-your-schedule-in-advance-of-civilization-vi-october-21-launch">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 14:42:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30111/win10-insider-build-14342-extends-edge-and-kills-wi-fi-sense</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30111/win10-insider-build-14342-extends-edge-and-kills-wi-fi-sense</guid><title>Win10 Insider Build 14342 extends Edge and kills Wi-Fi Sense</title><description><p>Microsoft&nbsp;released a new preview build for Windows 10 Insiders on the fast ring today. The headline news for today&rsquo;s build, <a href="https://blogs.windows.com/windowsexperience/2016/05/10/announcing-windows-10-insider-preview-build-14342/">Build 14342</a>, is a change to the way that Edge users will interact with extensions for the browser. We also get the usual laundry list of bug fixes in this update.</p><p>In the past, browser extensions for Edge have been extracted and loaded from a local folder. With the new build, Microsoft says the extensions can be downloaded directly from the Windows store. It sounds like the change  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30111/win10-insider-build-14342-extends-edge-and-kills-wi-fi-sense">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 09:47:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30110/gddr5x-enters-mass-production-ahead-of-schedule</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30110/gddr5x-enters-mass-production-ahead-of-schedule</guid><title>GDDR5X enters mass production ahead of schedule</title><description><p>In a <a href="https://www.micron.com/about/blogs/2016/may/nvidia-launches-gtx1080-with-micron-gddr5x">blog post yesterday</a> about the <a href="http://techreport.com/news/30094/nvidia-makes-the-gtx-1070-and-gtx-1080-official">GeForce GTX 1080 launch</a>, Micron confirmed something we&#39;ve&nbsp;suspected since this past Friday: GDDR5X memory is in mass production now.&nbsp;That news beats the projected &quot;summer&quot; timeline for GDDR5X mass production <a href="http://techreport.com/news/29700/micron-reports-early-successes-in-gddr5x-production">we reported on earlier this year</a>.</p><p><img height="272" src="http://techreport.com/r.x/2016_2_9_Micron_reports_early_successes_in_GDDR5X_production/gddr5x.jpg" width="484" />  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30110/gddr5x-enters-mass-production-ahead-of-schedule">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 09:01:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30107/thermalright-le-grand-macho-rt-makes-other-coolers-look-wimpy</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30107/thermalright-le-grand-macho-rt-makes-other-coolers-look-wimpy</guid><title>Thermalright Le Grand Macho RT makes other coolers look wimpy</title><description><p>It&#39;s no secret that companies love preying on consumers&#39; insecurities about size&mdash;whether it&#39;s for height, trucks, or body appendages. The mean folks at Thermalright have joined that party by trying to make us all feel bad about the inadequacy of our CPU coolers. Enter the <a href="http://www.thermalright.com/html/products/cpu_cooler/le_grand_macho_rt.html?panel=1">Le Grand Macho RT</a> CPU cooler&mdash;all 2 lbs (900g) of it.</p><p><img height="512" src="http://techreport.com/r.x/2016_5_10_Thermalright_Le_Grand_Macho_RT_makes_your_CPU_cooler_feel_wimpy/thermalright_macho_rt.jpg" width="580" />  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30107/thermalright-le-grand-macho-rt-makes-other-coolers-look-wimpy">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 08:00:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30108/wd-sandisk-acquisition-clears-final-regulatory-hurdle</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30108/wd-sandisk-acquisition-clears-final-regulatory-hurdle</guid><title>WD-SanDisk acquisition clears final regulatory hurdle</title><description><p>Back in October of last year, Western Digital announced its intent to&nbsp;<a href="http://techreport.com/news/29223/western-digital-buys-sandisk-for-19-billion">buy SanDisk for $19 billion</a>. While the road to completing that acquisition has been rocky, it looks as though the two companies have cleared the last of the hurdles keeping the deal from going through. <a href="http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20160510005672/en/SanDisk-Announces-Final-Regulatory-Approval-Acquisition-Western">SanDisk reports</a> that it has received approval from the Ministry of Commerce of China to allow the deal to go forward. The two companies expect to close the deal May 12, 2016.</p><p>Back in February, it looked like this deal might <a href="http://techreport.com/news/29756/western-digital-experiences-a-setback-in-its-sandisk-acquisition">fall through</a> . Western Digital had initially expected a $3.7 billion equity investment from Unis United as part of the deal, but Unis&nbsp;backed out when the US Committee on Foreign Investment  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30108/wd-sandisk-acquisition-clears-final-regulatory-hurdle">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 07:00:00 -0500</pubDate></item><item><link>http://techreport.com/news/30106/mastercase-maker-5-evolves-cooler-master-modular-concept</link><guid isPermaLink="true">http://techreport.com/news/30106/mastercase-maker-5-evolves-cooler-master-modular-concept</guid><title>MasterCase Maker 5 evolves Cooler Master's modular concept</title><description><p><a href="http://techreport.com/review/28796/cooler-master-mastercase-5-reviewed">Cooler Master&#39;s MasterCase 5 and MasterCase Pro 5</a> are both solid, flexible cases that can be upgraded at will thanks to their modular interiors and a variety of aftermarket parts. Today, Cooler Master is releasing the next evolution in its modular MasterCase family: <a href="http://www.coolermaster.com/case/mid-tower/mastercase-maker-5/">the MasterCase Maker 5</a>. This case features redesigned top and front panels, a built-in fan and lighting hub, and a refreshed front I/O panel with what we believe is a first for an ATX mid-tower: a USB Type-C port.</p><p><img height="512" src="http://techreport.com/r.x/2016_5_10_MasterCase_Maker_5_evolves_Cooler_Masters_modular_concept/maker5basic.jpg" width="372" />  ...</p><p><a href="http://techreport.com/news/30106/mastercase-maker-5-evolves-cooler-master-modular-concept">Read more...</a></p></description><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 15:33:00 -0500</pubDate></item></channel></rss>
